DataElement.preferredName: Patient Protocol Specified Prior Systemic Therapy Exclusion Eligibility Determination Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no indicator related to a patient's eligibility based on protocol specified prior systemic therapy.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Protocol Specified Prior Systemic Therapy Exclusion Eligibility Determination
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._A protocol is a rule which guides how an activity should be performed; a set of formal rules used to specify the format of an exchange of data._Specified; clearly and explicitly stated._Earlier in time or order._(sis-TEM-ik THER-a-pee) Treatment using substances that travel through the bloodstream, reaching and affecting cells all over the body._The deliberate act of omission._Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Protocol Specified Prior Systemic Therapy Exclusion Eligibility Determination
Property.preferredDefinition: A protocol is a rule which guides how an activity should be performed; a set of formal rules used to specify the format of an exchange of data.:Specified; clearly and explicitly stated.:Earlier in time or order.:(sis-TEM-ik THER-a-pee) Treatment using substances that travel through the bloodstream, reaching and affecting cells all over the body.:The deliberate act of omission.:Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services.

Concepts.definition: A rule which guides how an activity should be performed.
Treatment using substances that travel through the bloodstream, reaching and affecting cells all over the body.
The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Patients must not be on any o
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patients must not be on any other systemic therapy within the following intervals before study enrollment.  a) 1 week after stereotactic radiosurgery of the brain or comparable technology. b) 4 weeks after cytotoxic chemotherapy or external beam radiation therapy. c) 6 weeks after chemotherapy regimens including BCNU (carmustine) or mitomycin C. d) 12 weeks after ipilimumab, PD-1 antibody, or other immunologically active antibody.

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient receiving other cancer directed therapy at the time of enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Not have received prior systemic therapy for MCC

ReferenceDocuments.name: CITN
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patients must not be on any other systemic therapy within the following intervals before study enrollment. a) 1 week after stereotactic radiosurgery of the brain or comparable technology. b) 4 weeks after cytotoxic chemotherapy or external beam radiation therapy. c) 6 weeks after chemotherapy regimens including BCNU (carmustine) or mitomycin C. d) patients who experience melanoma progression (by RECIST 1.1 criteria) while on or after treatment with PD-1 or PDL-1 antibody may enroll on this study. e) 8 weeks after ipilimumab, other CTLA-4 antibody or other immunologically active antibody.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has it been a minimum of 12 weeks from the first dose of anti-CTLA-4 and > 6 weeks from the last dose to randomization?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has stereotactic radiosurgery been completed at least 21 days prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has it been a minimum of 12 weeks from the first dose of anti-CTLA-4 and at least 6 weeks from the last dose to randomization?
